alert.note: Alert for Sonoran Desert Natl Monument (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 7:16PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 800 PM MST... At 716 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sonoran National Monument, or 9 miles northeast of Gila Bend, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Estrella and Sonoran National Monument. This includes AZ Route 238 between mile markers 9 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
